meanings.definition: A step or level in a hierarchy or system.
meanings.sent1: She climbed up the ladder, placing her foot on each rung carefully.
meanings.sent2: The highest rung of the corporate ladder is often the most challenging to reach.
meanings.sent3: The rung of success she aimed for seemed just out of reach.
meanings.sent4: He saw each rung of the ladder as a new opportunity to grow and learn.
meanings.sent5: The rung of responsibility she held in the team made her a valuable member.

meanings.definition: A circular band of metal or wood forming the part of a wheel on which the spokes are fitted.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic examined the rung of the wheel to check for any damage.
meanings.sent2: The rung of the bicycle wheel was sturdy and well-crafted.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally kicked the rung of the wheel, causing it to wobble comically.
meanings.sent4: The rung of the wheel spun smoothly as the bicycle glided down the hill.
meanings.sent5: The shiny rung of the wheel caught the sunlight, gleaming brightly.

meanings.sent1: She found the rung bell hidden in the attic, covered in dust.
meanings.sent2: The rung bell chimed softly in the evening breeze.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the rung bell had a magical sound that granted wishes.
meanings.sent4: The rung bell's sound echoed through the quiet village, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The rung bell's intricate design made it a cherished family heirloom.
